wellr 0.1.0
  • Reference

Convert a DataFrame to a Multi-Frame Matrix

Source: R/plate.R
well_df_to_mat_frames.Rd

Converts a DataFrame to a matrix where each row is a single time point, and each column is a single well. The wells are in index order, indexing across the rows so the first values are all from row A.

well_df_to_mat_frames(data, values_col, time_col, well_col = "well")

Arguments

data

A DataFrame to be converted.

values_col

The name of the column containing the values.

time_col

The name of the column containing the time values.

well_col

The name of the column with the well IDs.

Value

a matrix

Examples

df_list <- lapply(1:10, function(x) {
  df <- wellr::well_plate()
  df$value <- rnorm(96)
  df$frame <- x
  df
})

df_frames <- do.call(rbind, df_list)

# convert the data frame to multi-frame matrix
mat <- well_df_to_mat_frames(
  data = df_frames,
  values_col = "value",
  time_col = "frame"
)

head(mat[, 1:14])
